title: Better Textured Fonts than Papyrus?
content:
Well I have never liked papyrus for some reason. But I see a lot of fonts with similar weathered edges, especially for day spas lol, and I am wondering what are some better fonts with this look?

Some other examples might be maybe Operina Romano, Allegheny, Old Claude, MVB Celestia Antiqua...
author: j_polo9

comments.content:
Alternately use these hand filters to weather any font...

[http://www.misterretro.com/image\_filters.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.misterretro.com/image_filters.html "http://www.misterretro.com/image\_filters.html")

I have used ITC Tempus in place of Papyrus a few times

[http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tempus](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tempus "http://www.myfonts.com/search?search%5Btext%5D=tempus")

Not all of these are textured in the same way as Papyrus, but here are some rough serifs akin to the Old Claude and MVB Celestia Antiqua you mentioned:  
 [Garamond Rough](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=EF.109185.0.0)  
 [MVB Gryphius](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=MVB.118641.0.0)  
 [ITC Founders Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=founders)  
 [Linotype Compendio](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.102878.0.0)  
 [Grit Primer](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=BL.116996.0.0)  
 [FF Irregular](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.8505.0.0)  
 [ITC Old Times](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=C.118545.0.0)  
 [Marco Polo](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/marco-polo/?refby=typographica)

Weathered, antiqued, worn, rough, textured.

Here's FontShop's [Photoshop tip for creating a weathered affect](http://web.archive.org/web/20100523073226/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontfeed/archives/how_to_create_a.cfm#comments). Could modify it for your use.
